schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

experiment_target.name: experiment target
experiment_target.description: Input molecule. What the experiment was trying to find, list the text rather than ontology link, for example 'polyA RNA'.

library_construction.name: library construction
library_construction.description: The library construction method (including version) that was used, e.g. 'Smart-Seq2', 'Drop-Seq', '10X v3'. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

primer.name: primer
primer.description: The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. 'oligo-dT' or 'random' primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input e.g. enriched for mRNA. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

amplification_method.name: amplification method
amplification_method.description: The method used to amplify RNA, e.g. 'PCR' or 'in vitro transcription'. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

amplification_cycles.name: amplification cycles
amplification_cycles.description: The number of cycles used to multiply the RNA.

end_bias.name: end bias
end_bias.description: The end of the cDNA molecule that is preferentially sequenced, e.g. 3/5 prime tag or end, or the full-length transcript. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

library_strand.name: library strand
library_strand.description: The strandedness of the library, whether reads come from both strands of the cDNA or only from the first (antisense) or the second (sense) strand. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

spike_in.name: spike in
spike_in.description: Spike-in RNAs are synthetic RNA molecules with known sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix. e.g. the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set is commonly used in single-cell experiments. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.name: spike in dilution or concentration
spike_in_dilution_or_concentration.description: The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix, e.g. '1:40,000'. Contact the FAANG DCC to add more terms.

library_generation_protocol.name: library generation protocol
library_generation_protocol.description: Link to the protocol used to generate the library. How was the cDNA library constructed? If a kit was used name, manufacturer, catalogue number, lot and date of manufacture should be included.

sequencing_protocol.name: sequencing protocol
sequencing_protocol.description: Link to the protocol used to generate the library. How was the sequencing done, were any special parameters used? How many sequencing runs were done? Expected read lengths.

read_strand.name: read strand
read_strand.description: For strand specific protocol, specify which mate pair maps to the transcribed strand or Report 'non-stranded' if the protocol is not strand specific. For single-ended sequencing: use 'sense' if the reads should be on the same strand as the transcript, 'antisense' if on opposite strand. For paired-end sequencing: 'mate 1 sense' if mate 1 should be on the same strand as the transcript, 'mate 2 sense' if mate 2 should be on the same strand as the transcript.

rna_purity_260-280_ratio.name: rna purity 260:280 ratio
rna_purity_260-280_ratio.description: Sample purity assesed with fluoresence ratio at 260 and 280nm, informative for protein contamination.

rna_purity_260-230_ratio.name: rna purity 260:230 ratio
rna_purity_260-230_ratio.description: Sample purity assesed with fluoresence ratio at 260 and 230nm, informative for contamination by phenolate ion, thiocyanates, and other organic compounds.

rna_integrity_number.name: rna integrity number
rna_integrity_number.description: It is important to obtain this value, but if you are unable to supply this number (e.g. due to machine failure) then by submitting you are asserting the quality by visual inspection of traces and agreeing that the samples were suitable for sequencing. For more information on RNA Integrity Numbers see Schroeder et al. (2006) http://bmcmolbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2199-7-3.
